name: Agentic AI
description: AI systems that can autonomously plan, execute, and adapt multi-step tasks with minimal human intervention, using tool use, reasoning, and memory.
accuracyNote: Promising direction but practical deployment is limited barely a year out. Most 'agents' still fail at complex multi-step tasks. Too early for a high score — the scope and reliability aren't there yet.

name: AI Governance Platforms
description: Platforms and frameworks to manage AI model lifecycle, ensure compliance, monitor for bias, and maintain transparency across enterprise AI deployments.
accuracyNote: Growing but still emerging. The prediction is barely a year old — scoring it highly is premature. Wait for more evidence before calling this accurate.

name: Disinformation Security
description: Technologies and practices to detect, prevent, and respond to AI-generated disinformation including deepfakes, synthetic media, and AI-powered influence campaigns.
accuracyNote: Deepfake detection and C2PA exist but are not widely deployed. Too early to score a 2025 prediction highly when it's less than a year old.

name: Postquantum Cryptography
description: Cryptographic algorithms designed to be secure against both classical and quantum computer attacks. Organizations need to begin transitioning now.
accuracyNote: Important but early — NIST published post-quantum standards (2024), but actual enterprise migration is just beginning. Quantum threats remain theoretical for now.

name: Ambient Invisible Intelligence
description: Ultra-low-cost smart tags and sensors creating an environment of invisible, always-on intelligence for tracking, sensing, and monitoring at massive scale.
accuracyNote: Very early — while RFID and sensor costs decreased, the vision of pervasive invisible intelligence hasn't materialized. Still more concept than reality.

name: Energy-Efficient Computing
description: New computing paradigms (neuromorphic, optical, energy-harvesting chips) and software optimization to dramatically reduce AI and cloud computing's energy consumption.
accuracyNote: Growing urgency — AI energy consumption is a real concern driving investment, but revolutionary new computing paradigms remain in research. Software optimization is more practical.

name: Hybrid Computing
description: Combining different computing paradigms — classical, quantum, edge, neuromorphic — into unified architectures optimized for specific workloads.
accuracyNote: Mostly aspirational — cloud/edge hybrid is real, but quantum and neuromorphic integration remains experimental. The fully hybrid vision is years away.

name: Spatial Computing
description: Technologies that digitally enhance the physical world, including AR, VR, and mixed reality, creating interactive 3D experiences for work and consumer applications.
accuracyNote: Apple Vision Pro launched but adoption is very limited. Meta Quest has a niche following. Spatial computing remains a small market despite significant investment.

name: Polyfunctional Robots
description: Robots capable of performing multiple tasks and adapting to different environments, moving beyond single-purpose industrial robots to versatile, AI-powered machines.
accuracyNote: Very early — humanoid robots from Figure, Tesla (Optimus), and Boston Dynamics show promise but are far from practical deployment. Mostly demo stage.

name: Neurological Enhancement
description: Technologies that read and decode brain activity to enhance human cognitive abilities, including brain-computer interfaces and neurostimulation devices.
accuracyNote: Extremely premature — Neuralink's early implants are medical-focused, not cognitive enhancement. Consumer brain-computer interfaces don't exist. Decades away from mainstream.
